intro: Hibbertia miniata, commonly known as the small-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red veins. The plant typically grows in shrubland and heathland habitats, often in sandy or rocky soils. Hibbertia miniata has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. It is a perennial species that is well adapted to the dry and sunny conditions of its native environment.
